data.title: Signing of the agreement concerning the establishment of SHAPE in Belgium (Brussels, 13 May 1967)
meta_keywords: signing of the agreement concerning the establishment of shape in belgium (brussels
data.meta_description: On 10 March 1966, General de Gaulle officially announces that France intends to withdraw from the Atlantic Alliance’s integrated military command. Forced to leave its headquarters previously located at Marly-le-Roi, Yvelines, the Alliance transfers its headquarters to Brussels and Casteau, Belgium, pursuant to an agreement signed in Brussels on 13 May 1967 between Pierre Harmel, Belgian Foreign Minister, and the US General Lyman Lemnitzer, Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR).
